intro: Paris tengchongensis, commonly known as the Tengchong Paris, is a rare and endangered species native to China. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as mountain forests, where it thrives in cool and humid conditions. Its leaves are lanceolate and arranged in a basal rosette, and it produces berries that are toxic to humans. Due to habitat destruction and over-collection, it is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
